page.title: 11Living in Kirdford.
page.content: Life in Kirdford is fairly typical of a Sussex village in the 1980's. The stable population of mixed ages live in pleasant surroundings in a mixture of owned or rented accommodation. The employment level is quite high. 30% work in Kirdford in agricultural or service industries while the remaining go further afield to places like Horsham, Billingshurst, Guildford and Pulborough. The only bus service through the village goes from Horsham to Petworth four times a day consequently 81% of the people surveyed owned either one or more cars. These are used for transport to and from work and collecting essential supplies,there being only two local shops. Almost everyone enjoyed living in the community because of its peaceful and friendly atmosphere.
